meanings.definition: Showing reverence and adoration towards a deity or religious figure.
meanings.sent1: The children sang a worshipful hymn during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The worshipful monk prayed silently in front of the altar.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a worshipful look to its favorite toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky seemed to gaze down in a worshipful manner.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a worshipful portrait of the saint.

meanings.sent1: The elderly lady received a worshipful greeting from the community.
meanings.sent2: His hard work and dedication made him a worshipful figure in the company.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics were met with worshipful applause.
meanings.sent4: The majestic mountain stood tall, commanding a worshipful view.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's wise words were met with a worshipful silence.

meanings.definition: A title of respect for certain officials or dignitaries.
meanings.sent1: The Worshipful Mayor addressed the crowd at the town hall meeting.
meanings.sent2: The Worshipful Master of the guild led the ceremony with grace.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child jokingly called his friend 'Worshipful Explorer'.
meanings.sent4: The title of Worshipful Judge carried great weight in the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The royal decree was signed by the Worshipful Chancellor.
